answerText: Tituba[10] The aforementioned events occur in this Arthur Miller play, seen as an allegory for McCarthyism.
heading: NASAT |2013 | 5 | 19 | Literature | American | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: Ann Putnam accuses this character of being able to speak to the dead. For 10 points each: [10] Name this slave from Barbados belonging to Reverend Parris, who supposedly teaches witchcraft to a group of Puritan girls in Salem.
